Ask questions. Admitting confusion can be a hard step, especially for new engineers who feel self-conscious about not living up to the high expectations that got them hired. Because Iâ€™m cognizant of this feeling, I challenge myself to ask questions, because, without them, my growth would be greatly impeded.

I anticipate having a highly personalized engineering experience that stretches me where I want to grow, which often doesnâ€™t happen at larger companies.

Check in and check out. At the end of each day, I write down what I accomplished and what Iâ€™d like to accomplish the next day. This has helped me track my progress and remember where I left off, which has improved my productivity. Plus, taking a break from my laptop to write in a journal feels really nice.

Say yes! Nope, not to the dress, but to going with your co-workers to do things!
